name: Duck Jalapeno Poppers
author: jbird16
summary: Jalapeno stuffed with fresh duck, cream cheese, pepper jack cheese, and wrapped in thick bacon.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon ground chipotle pepper (such as Mrs. Dash Southwest Chipotle Seasoning Blend®)
8  jalapeno peppers - stemmed, seeded, and halved lengthwise, or to taste
1 (8 ounce) package pepper Jack cheese, sliced, or to taste
8 thick slices bacon, or to taste
directions: Clean and rinse duck breasts thoroughly in cold water
Cut into 1/4-inch slices and place in a resealable plastic bag with water and salt
Remove from bag and rinse again under cold running water
Combine duck, ground  chipotle pepper, vinegar, Worcestershire sauce, monosodium glutamate, garlic powder, and hot pepper sauce in a resealable plastic bag
Refrigerate until well marinated, 2 to 3 hours more
Fill jalapenos with pepper Jack cheese and cream cheese
Cut bacon strips in half and wrap each stuffed pepper with a bacon strip
Preheat an outdoor grill for 400 degrees F (204 degrees C) and lightly oil the grate
Cook jalapeno peppers, flipping once or twice, until bacon is browned, about 15 minutes
